channel.title: Customer Settings on PrestaShop Specs
channel.description: Recent content in Customer Settings on PrestaShop Specs

item.title: Add edit social titles
item.description: Social titlesIn this section 5 fields are presented: Social title This is a mandatory input field, the field is multi language, can be translated to a selected language that is installed on the shop. Has a tooltip: “Invalid characters: 0-9!<>,;?=+()@#”{}_$%:". Trying to save with the field empty will show an error: “The field name is required at least in default shop language”. Trying to save with invalid characters, should show an error but is not (See issue #28320).

item.title: Add new group
item.description: Customer groupIn this section 5 sections are presented: Name This is a mandatory input field, also it is multi language, so can be translated to any language which is enabled on the shop. When trying to save with the field empty, will show a message: “The field name is required at least in (language)”. Has a tooltip: “Forbidden characters:0-9!<>,;?=+()@#”{}_$%:". When trying to save with forbidden characters input will show an error: “The name field is invalid.

item.title: Customer settings
item.description: GeneralIn this section 6 fields are presented: Re-display cart at login This is a mandatory toggle switch, by default it is set to: “No”. Has a help text below: “After a customer logs in, you can recall and display the content of his/her last shopping cart.”. Send an email after registration This is a mandatory toggle switch, by default it is set to: “Yes”. Has a help text below: “Send an email with a summary of the account information after registration.

item.title: Customers Page
item.description: SPECIFICATIONS - CUSTOMERS SETTINGS > CUSTOMERS PAGE GeneralAs a merchant, I want to be able to define my preferences to manage my customers. Re-display cart at login. By default, this option is disabled. When enabled, if a customer has left a cart unchecked-out, it displays it again when he/she logs back in. It should even memorize at what step of the checkout the customer stops so that he/she can go back directly to where the checkout was stopped.

item.title: Edit customer
item.description: CustomerIn this section the customer details which are already input will show, and all of them can be edited: Social title There are 2 options in this field, can select “Mr.” or “Mrs.”. First name This is a mandatory field, has a help text below: “Only letters and the dot (.) character, followed by a space, are allowed.”. Trying to save with the field empty, will show a message by the field: “Please fill out this field”.

item.title: Edit group
item.description: Customer groupIn this section 6 sections are presented (when multistore is enabled the count is 7): Name This is a mandatory input field, also it is multi language, so can be translated to any language which is enabled on the shop. When trying to save with the field empty, will show a message: “The field name is required at least in (language)".Has a tooltip: “Forbidden characters:0-9!<>,;?=+()@#”{}_$%:”. When trying to save with forbidden characters input will show an error: “The name field is invalid.

item.title: Groups
item.description: Call to action Add new group, redirects to the [specs of the add new group](https://build.prestashop.com/prestashop-specs/1.7/back-office/shop-parameters/customer-settings/add-new-group.html “Add new group) Below an explanation is shown: PrestaShop has three default customer groups: Visitor - All persons without a customer account or customers that are not logged in. Guest - All persons who placed an order through Guest Checkout. Customer - All persons who created an account on this site. GroupsIn this page the customer groups are displayed

item.title: Groups Page
item.description: SPECIFICATIONS - CUSTOMERS SETTINGS > GROUPS PAGEAs a merchant, I want to be able to group my customers. Summary Customers groups listing Customers groups options Customers groups multistore behavior Customers groups add form Customers groups edit form Customers groups view form Information notificationBy default, a blue information notification is displayed on the top of the page: PrestaShop has three default customer groups: Visitor - All persons without a customer account or customers that are not logged in.

item.title: Titles Page
item.description: SPECIFICATIONS - CUSTOMERS SETTINGS > TITLES PAGEAs a merchant, I want to be able to define my customers. ListingAs usual, four tables options are displayed on the top-right hand corner as icons: Add new Refresh list Show SQL query Export to SQL manager By default, the table is divided into the following columns: ID Social title Gender Image To allow users to narrow down their search, searching and/or sorting options are available according to the columns:

item.title: View group
item.description: In this page 3 separate blocks are shown: Group informationDisplays the group section, below that: Discount: displays the discount number in percentages. Price display method: displays if the VAT is included or excluded. Show prices: displays id the prices is shown or not. Current category discountDisplays the discounts possible for this group, if there are no discount will show: “None”. Settings wheel Refresh list After clicking on it, the page is reloaded.

item.title: View titles
item.description: Call to action Add new social title button: call to action, when pressed redirects to the specs of the add/edit social titles Settings wheel Add new After clicking on it, redirects to the specs of the add/edit social titles Refresh list After clicking on it, the page is reloaded. Sorts and searches are kept. Show SQL query After clicking on it, the SQL query is displayed in a modal. The SQL query takes into account filters and sorts that have been done.
